0: Prepare and process import and export documentation according to customs regulations, laws, or procedures.
Clear goods through customs and to their destinations for clients.
Pay, or arrange for payment of, taxes and duties on shipments.
Calculate duty and tariff payments owed on shipments.
Request or compile necessary import documentation, such as customs invoices, certificates of origin, and cargo-control documents.
Classify goods according to tariff coding system.
Stay abreast of changes in import or export laws or regulations by reading current literature, attending meetings or conferences, or conferring with colleagues.
Sign documents on behalf of clients, using powers of attorney.
Advise customers on import and export restrictions, tariff systems, insurance requirements, quotas, or other customs-related matters.
Post bonds for the products being imported or assist clients in obtaining bonds.
Quote duty and tax rates on goods to be imported, based on federal tariffs and excise taxes.
Arrange for transportation, warehousing, or product distribution of imported or exported products.
Monitor or trace the location of goods.
Confer with officials in various agencies to facilitate clearance of goods through customs and quarantine.
Inform importers and exporters of steps to reduce duties and taxes.
Obtain line releases for frequent shippers of low-risk commodities, high-volume entries, or multiple-container loads.
Provide advice on transportation options, types of carriers, or shipping routes.
Contract with freight forwarders for destination services.
Apply for tariff concessions or for duty drawbacks and other refunds.
Insure cargo against loss, damage, or pilferage.
Prepare papers for shippers to appeal duty charges.
1: Analyze training needs to develop new training programs or modify and improve existing programs.
Evaluate instructor performance and the effectiveness of training programs, providing recommendations for improvement.

Plan, develop, and provide training and staff development programs, using knowledge of the effectiveness of methods such as classroom training, demonstrations, on-the-job training, meetings, conferences, and workshops.
Confer with management and conduct surveys to identify training needs based on projected production processes, changes, and other factors.
Conduct orientation sessions and arrange on-the-job training for new hires.
Train instructors and supervisors in techniques and skills for training and dealing with employees.
Develop and organize training manuals, multimedia visual aids, and other educational materials.
Prepare training budget for department or organization.
Develop testing and evaluation procedures.
Conduct or arrange for ongoing technical training and personal development classes for staff members.
Review and evaluate training and apprenticeship programs for compliance with government standards.
2: Monitor and record food temperatures to ensure food safety.
Cook foodstuffs according to menus, special dietary or nutritional restrictions, or numbers of portions to be served.
Rotate and store food supplies.
Wash pots, pans, dishes, utensils, or other cooking equipment.
Apportion and serve food to facility residents, employees, or patrons.
Clean and inspect galley equipment, kitchen appliances, and work areas to ensure cleanliness and functional operation.
Clean, cut, and cook meat, fish, or poultry.
Direct activities of one or more workers who assist in preparing and serving meals.
Train new employees.
Take inventory of supplies and equipment.
Requisition food supplies, kitchen equipment, and appliances, based on estimates of future needs.
Bake breads, rolls, or other pastries.

0: Facilitate the smooth entry of goods into a country by processing export declarations, clearing shipments, and resolving customs issues.
Conduct thorough inspections of shipments to ensure compliance with relevant laws and regulations.
Evaluate the accuracy of commercial invoices, packing lists, and other documentation to ensure accurate payment calculations.
Gather and verify information from exporters, importers, and shipping lines to facilitate customs clearance.
Presents complex customs issues to senior management or other stakeholders for resolution.
Negotiate with government officials and regulatory bodies to resolve disputes and optimize trade agreements.
Prepare and submit export compliance documentation to relevant authorities.
Determine the applicable tariffs, duties, and taxes on shipments in accordance with international trade laws.
Collaborate with importers and shipping lines to obtain necessary documentation for customs clearance.
Monitor shipments at designated entry points, such as airports or seaports, to ensure compliance with regulations.
Facilitate communication between exporters, importers, and government agencies regarding customs-related matters.
Process shipment manifest changes, such as revisions to cargo, destination, or ownership.
Maintain accurate records of shipments, cargo details, and relevant documentation.
Hire and supervise warehouse personnel to ensure secure storage of shipments and maintain compliance with regulations.
Liaise with banks and financial institutions to facilitate customs-related transactions, such as letter of credit issues.
Verify the authenticity of company documents, including letters of authorization and certifications of origin.
Evaluate potential risks associated with imports, such as product safety or regulatory compliance issues.
Hire specialized equipment, such as scanning software, to streamline customs processing.
Prepare for and respond to inspections by government officials, presenting necessary documentation and explanations.
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of international trade laws, regulations, and agreements.
Familiarize companies with the implications of changes in tariffs, duties, or other trade policies on their operations.
1: Develop, implement, and evaluate comprehensive training programs to enhance employee skills and knowledge.
Design, organize, and deliver training sessions that align with organizational goals and objectives.
Conduct needs assessments to identify training gaps and prioritize training initiatives.
Create, edit, and update training materials such as manuals, guides, and presentations.
Identify and partner with external vendors to provide specialized training services or resources.
Design and implement a performance management system to track employee training progress and effectiveness.
Facilitate coaching, mentoring, and feedback sessions for employees to enhance skill development and job satisfaction.
Research, recommend, and procure technology solutions to support training initiatives and improve learning experiences.
Develop and maintain a library of company knowledge and best practices documentation.
Evaluate the impact of training programs on organizational performance using metrics such as employee engagement and productivity.
Collaborate with senior leadership to develop strategic plans for training and development initiatives that align with business objectives.
2: Prepares and cooks food according to menu specifications.
Maintains a clean and organized kitchen environment throughout service hours.
Inspects ingredients for quality and freshness before preparing meals.
Ensures all food safety protocols are followed during food preparation.
Manages inventory of pantry supplies and orders as needed.
Prepares beverages, such as juice or coffee, according to customer requests.
Plates dishes according to institutional standards and presentation requirements.
Provides exceptional customer service by taking food orders and answering questions.
Resolves any food allergies or dietary restrictions in a prompt and courteous manner.
Maintains accurate records of ingredient usage and inventory levels.
Refrigerates, freezes, or discards perishable items as needed to maintain optimal storage conditions.
Serves food in a timely and efficient manner while maintaining high standards of quality and presentation.
